intro: Baccharis stenocephala, commonly known as narrow-headed baccharis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, often covered in a fine layer of hair. Baccharis stenocephala is adapted to dry environments and is often found in grasslands and shrublands.
